alert.note: Alert for Blair; Huntingdon; Juniata; Mifflin; Northern Centre; Northern Clinton; Potter; Southern Centre (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 22 at 11:02AM EDT until June 22 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 2 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of central Pennsylvania, including the following areas, Adams, Bedford, Blair, Cumberland, Franklin, Fulton, Huntingdon, Juniata, Mifflin, Northern Centre, Northern Clinton, Northern Lycoming, Perry, Potter, Snyder, Southern Centre, Southern Clinton, Southern Lycoming, Tioga and Union. * WHEN...From 2 PM EDT this afternoon through this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - An area of showers and thunderstorms is expected to form this afternoon and early evening. Locally heavy rainfall from repeat thunderstorms could result in localized rainfall totals of 3 to 4 inches. If this rain falls within a shorter time window (1 to 2 hours), localized flooding may occur. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: Blair; Huntingdon; Juniata; Mifflin; Northern Centre; Northern Clinton; Potter; Southern Centre
